sinhaladictionarytools.lib
Class JavaSystemCaller.ExecEnvironmentFactory

java.lang.Object
  sinhaladictionarytools.lib.JavaSystemCaller.ExecEnvironmentFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
JavaSystemCaller.UnixExecEnvFactory, JavaSystemCaller.WindowsExecEnvFactory
Enclosing class:
JavaSystemCaller
public abstract static class JavaSystemCaller.ExecEnvironmentFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Environment needed to be build for the Exec class to be able to execute the system command.
Must have the right shell and the right command line.

Constructor Summary

          Builds an execution environment for a system command to be played.

Constructor Detail

JavaSystemCaller.ExecEnvironmentFactory

public JavaSystemCaller.ExecEnvironmentFactory(java.lang.String aCommand,
                                               java.lang.String... someParameters)
Builds an execution environment for a system command to be played.
Independent from the OS.

Parameters:
aCommand - system command to be executed (must not be null or empty)
someParameters - parameters of the command (must not be null or empty)
Method Detail

createShell

public abstract JavaSystemCaller.IShell createShell()
Builds the right Shell for the current OS.
Allow for independent platform execution.

Returns:
right shell, NEVER NULL

createCommandLine

public abstract java.lang.String createCommandLine()
Builds the right command line for the current OS.
Means that a command might be translated, if it does not fit the right OS ('dir' => 'ls' on unix)

Returns:
right complete command line, with parameters added (NEVER NULL)
